main_question: Sir Louis-Hippolyte La Fontaine was known for:
possible_answers: A. A champion of democracy and Aboriginal rights
B. A champion of democracy and French language rights and the first leader of a responsible government in the Canadas
C. The first Head of State
D. The first French-speaking Prime Minister
answer: B. A champion of democracy and French language rights and the first leader of a responsible government in the Canadas
explanatory_sentence: La Fontaine, a champion of democracy and French language rights, became the first leader of a responsible government in the Canadas.
